info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:28PM CDT until July 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR CLINTON AND SOUTHERN BOND COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS... MONROE AND MADISON COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...WESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS...RANDOLPH AND ST. CLAIR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND NORTHERN STE. GENEVIEVE COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN MISSOURI... At 427 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Prairietown to near St. Jacob to near Red Bud, moving east at 40 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR ST. CLAIR, MONROE, AND RANDOLPH COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. These severe storms will be near... Highland, Mascoutah, Red Bud, New Baden, Scott AFB, Trenton, New Athens, Aviston, Marine, and Alhambra around 435 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Marissa, St. Rose, Albers, Baldwin, New Memphis, Breese, Germantown, Pocahontas, Jamestown, Sparta, Okawville, Tilden, Carlyle, Beckemeyer, Lively Grove, Greenville, Coulterville and Beaver Creek. This also includes Felix Valle House State Park and Horseshoe Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 21 and 45. Interstate 55 in Illinois between exits 23 and 30. Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 9 and 41. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 157 and 170. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across ST. CLAIR, MONROE, AND RANDOLPH COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
